job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Requirements

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

How to Apply

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst translates complex business needs into structured requirements, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver testable, developer-ready solutions. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS environments with strong analytical and documentation skills.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering teams.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions.
  • Strong expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking knowledge: LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers.
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Monitoring/logging tools: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM.
  • Scripting skills: Python, Bash, Shell.
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Diploma/B.Tech/MCA in IT, CS, or MCA.
  • Experience in SOC operations or SIEM/SOAR tools.
  • Certifications: AWS Security/DevOps Engineer – Professional, CKS, CEH, CompTIA Security+.

Benefits

  • Growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and infrastructure automation for secure, scalable environments. Requires 4–8 years of DevOps/cloud experience with security expertise.

Job Description

The GIS Architect is responsible for designing and governing the geospatial architecture for a large, mission-critical enterprise platform reliant on mapping, location intelligence, and real-time spatial data. This role defines how ArcGIS Enterprise, geodatabases, and GIS services are structured, secured, and integrated with web, desktop, mobile, and operational systems across multiple on-premises data centres and a DR site. The GIS Architect leads the modernization of legacy GIS components into a scalable, high-availability geospatial platform, collaborating with application, database, infrastructure, and operations teams to ensure accurate, performant, and reliable mapping and spatial analysis capabilities.

Core Responsibilities

  • Define the overall GIS architecture, including ArcGIS Enterprise components, geodatabases, map/feature services, and real-time GIS services, ensuring scalability, high availability, and security across multiple data centres and a DR site.
  • Modernize legacy GIS implementations into a modern ArcGIS Enterprise-based landscape, rationalizing map services, refactoring geodatabases, and standardizing service publishing and consumption patterns.
  • Design and govern GIS services for web, desktop, mobile, and control-room applications, ensuring consistent APIs, performance, and cartographic standards for incident management, resource tracking, analytics, and reporting.
  • Collaborate with application, integration, and backend architects to define GIS service consumption by business modules (e.g., call taking, dispatch, resource management) and optimize data flows between GIS and transactional systems.
  • Establish spatial data modelling standards for base maps, operational layers, network datasets, address data, and reference layers for routing, proximity analysis, and spatial queries.
  • Ensure GIS components and data support active-active data centres and DR, including replication strategies, synchronization, and failover behaviour.
  • Optimize GIS hosting environments (e.g., ArcGIS Enterprise + Oracle) with infrastructure and database teams, including capacity planning and performance tuning.
  • Establish GIS security best practices, including user/role management, service-level permissions, data access policies, and integration with enterprise identity providers.
  • Provide technical leadership to GIS developers, analysts, and administrators, reviewing designs and implementations for alignment with the target architecture.

Technical Skills

  • Strong hands-on experience with ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal for ArcGIS, ArcGIS Server, ArcGIS Data Store) in on-premises, multi-server/multi-data-centre deployments.
  • Solid experience with ArcGIS Pro or equivalent tools for geodatabase management, map authoring, service publishing, and advanced spatial analysis.
  • Deep understanding of enterprise geodatabases (e.g., ArcGIS with Oracle), including schema design, indexing, spatial types, and performance tuning.
  • Knowledge of publishing and managing map services, feature services, geoprocessing services, and network analysis services for high-volume, real-time use.
  • Experience designing GIS solutions for routing, nearest resource identification, geocoding, and spatial operations.
  • Familiarity with integrating GIS services into web/mobile apps via REST APIs, JavaScript APIs, and client SDKs.
  • Understanding of GIS performance optimization (caching, scale settings, layer optimization, map design).
  • Security concepts in GIS platforms (authentication, authorization, SSL/TLS, enterprise identity integration).

Experience and Soft Skills

  • 8+ years in GIS solution design/implementation, with 3–4 years in an architect/lead role on enterprise GIS platforms.
  • Proven experience delivering mission-critical GIS solutions with strict uptime, data accuracy, and performance.
  • Experience in multi-datacentre/DR environments (replication, synchronization, high-availability patterns).

Technical Skills (SHOULD HAVE)

Experience (SHOULD HAVE)

Experience and Soft Skills - 12+ years in IT infrastructure, including 4+ years in enterprise-scale architecture. - Demonstrated success in designing data centers or private/hybrid cloud platforms. - Proficiency in documenting infrastructure with Visio, Draw.io, and Confluence. - Strong collaboration with cross-functional teams (application, DevOps, security, network). - Excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

Role: Security Architect Closing Date: 02, Jan 2026 Published: 26, Dec 2025 Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Job Description

The Security Architect is responsible for defining and governing the security architecture for mission-critical, on-premises enterprise platforms across multiple data centres and a dedicated disaster recovery site. This role designs and reviews security controls across applications, integrations, data, infrastructure, and identities to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability. The Security Architect collaborates with application, integration, infrastructure, network, and DevOps teams to embed security into the modernization of legacy systems into microservices and containerized workloads, while meeting strict regulatory, audit, and compliance requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Define the overall security architecture and reference patterns for applications, APIs, integrations, and data flows across on-premises environments and data centres.
  • Establish and maintain security standards for identity and access management (e.g., SSO, MFA, RBAC), network security (segmentation, firewalls, VPNs), and endpoint protection aligned with enterprise policies.
  • Work with Application, Integration, and API teams to ensure secure design of microservices, web applications, mobile/MDT clients, and external-facing APIs (authentication, authorization, input validation, secure session handling).
  • Collaborate with Infrastructure and Network teams to secure configurations of servers, containers, Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters, databases, load balancers, and WAFs in on-prem data centres and DR sites.
  • Define and review security controls for integrations with external systems (e.g., government systems, third-party services), including secure connectivity, data protection in transit/at rest, and endpoint hardening.
  • Oversee logging, monitoring, and alerting for security events, working with SIEM/SOC teams to detect, correlate, and respond to threats.
  • Drive secure SDLC and DevSecOps practices by embedding security requirements, threat modelling, and security testing (SAST, DAST, dependency/container scanning) into development and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Conduct architecture and design reviews for new solutions and change requests, identifying risks and recommending mitigations to ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements.
  • Define and maintain security baselines, hardening guides, and configuration benchmarks for platforms, middleware, and databases.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills

  • Strong understanding of security architecture principles for enterprise applications, APIs, microservices, and integrations in on-premises and hybrid environments.
  • Hands-on knowledge of identity and access management (Active Directory/LDAP, SSO, MFA, RBAC, OAuth2, OpenID Connect, JWT).
  • Application security fundamentals (OWASP Top 10, secure coding, input validation, secure session management).
  • Experience with network security controls (firewalls, VPNs, WAFs, network zoning).
  • Familiarity with containerized workloads (Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift), image scanning, runtime security, and cluster hardening.
  • Database/data security (encryption, hardening, least privilege, Oracle/relational databases).
  • Security logging/monitoring, SIEM platforms, and centralized log integration.

Experience and Soft Skills

  • 10+ years in information security, application security, or infrastructure security, with 3-4 years in a security architect role.
  • Proven experience designing security architectures for large-scale, mission-critical systems with uptime, performance, and compliance requirements.
  • Experience in multi-datacentre/DR environments, understanding failover, replication, and high availability.
  • Strong collaboration with cross-functional teams (application, infrastructure, DevOps, network, operations) to influence secure design decisions.
  • Excellent communication skills to articulate risks, options, and recommendations to technical/non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Lead threat modelling/risk assessments for key applications, integrations, and infrastructure components.
  • Define policies for secure access (privileged access, just-in-time access, break-glass accounts) with Infrastructure/Operations teams.
  • Support incident response/forensics by ensuring logging, evidence collection, and coordination with SOC teams.
  • Contribute to business continuity/DR planning from a security perspective.
  • Provide security guidance to architects, developers, DevOps engineers, and operations teams to promote security-by-design.

Technical Skills

  • Integrate security tools (SAST, DAST, dependency/container scanning) into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Familiarity with secrets management (secure storage, rotation, lifecycle management).
  • Knowledge of endpoint/server hardening (CIS benchmarks).
  • Working knowledge of encryption technologies (TLS, certificates, key management).

Experience

  • Modernization projects migrating legacy systems to modern architectures while improving security.
  • Environments subject to regulatory compliance (ISO 27001, SOC 2, PCI DSS).

Secondary Skills

  • Zero-trust architecture concepts in on-prem/hybrid environments.
  • Policy-as-code/security-as-code (Open Policy Agent).
  • SRE/observability concepts (SLIs/SLOs, error budgets).
  • Data classification/DLP/privacy-by-design principles.

Certifications

  • Security certifications: CISSP, CISM, SABSA.
  • Technical certifications: CCSP, GIAC (GCSA, GWEB), vendor-specific.
  • Formal training in secure software development, DevSecOps, or application security testing.

Application Instructions

  • Important: Reflections Info Systems does not charge fees for jobs. All communications are via official website, LinkedIn, or HR email. Contact Careers@reflectionsinfos.com for fraud alerts.
